page.title: 19Parrog Memories.
page.content: There would be as many as 30 sailing vessels in the bay waiting to unload coal,culm,china clay,lime,manure etc.,but there'd be 30 plus carts and horses for the unloading when the tide went out. We children would row out and swap potatoes for fish. One of our captains took ten local lads as crew one New Years - they never returned, Stephen Lewis,the one-armed ferryman charged 1/2d.to cross. The women helped the seine fishermen,gathered seaweed to sell s manure,gathered cockles,winkles,shrimps,prawns,spiked flatfish in the estuary,made lava bread,smoked herrings by the barrel in the 'Simne Fawr'. We used Rocket and Breeches Buoy for life-saving,still some drowned.
